intro: Cochlearia rivulorum, commonly known as the river cochlearia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and have a distinctive waxy coating. Native to alpine and arctic regions, it thrives in moist, rocky environments and is often found near streams and rivers.
